ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours
2 hours
1 hour
2 hours
2 hours/week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Excellent course. Provides and solidifies foundational skills in biostatistics, study design and evaluation.

The course provides overall information about clinical trial. The good thing is that through a final project, student can have a hands-on experience on designing a clinical trial. It helps student to think through the whole process. The overall workload is just at the good level. The weakness is maybe that the class is in the afternoon? It's easy to get drowsy at that time. It will be better to have group discussion session for the final project along the way than just turn in the whole thing at final week. It can force student to think and study the whole semester instead of just write up some random design in the end. Also the discussion can make the course more interactive.
Outstanding course and very good and practical approach to a very complicated topic

Passionate and good experience with clinical trials. The book is pretty good as well. Chapter 4 needs to be broken up and reorganized as it's basically an overview of the whole course and it takes too much time to go over all at once. Homeworks are okay, rather short. They should include questions pertinent directly to our ongoing final project so we can get feedback and be thinking about how these topics relate to our paper. Also couldn't read his handwritten notes to me.
excellent
taught clearly
The course is very useful in learning how to design a clinical trial.
Great topics coverage on clinical trials.
Love the course instructor. Learned a lot in the class.

The course was excellent. The slides were based on only one book prepared by the instructor. This made the course more focused on and more effective for learning what it matters. The format of delivery was also a strength since it allowed for questions at any time. Homework assignments helped to reinforce what we learned in class, and the project was a good opportunity to go over and apply what we have learned in the term. I cant see any weaknesses in the course.
Think it would be helpful to discuss the proposal assignment in detail earlier so that students can meet with the Professor earlier.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Excellent instructor. Does an incredible job of instilling a sense of intuition. Principles that had been difficult to grasp coalesced in a series of tools to create and evaluate multi-center clinical trials. Cares more about students' development than anything else.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  A good professor.

Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Outstanding instructor, very practical approach, highlights the most important issues in designing the trials, kindly provided a copy of his book that was very useful in studying

Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Cares a lot about his students and our education. Passionate and experience with clinical trials. Very prone to going off on tangents and losing focus. Needs to do a better job of staying on point or else our attention wanders, plus it's a long class. Had tremendous difficulties with the clicker for the computer and got flustered literally 30 times over the course of the semester.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  excellent and nice
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  he is excellent, responsible and helpful
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  He is an amazing professor who really cares about his students' success and getting to know them. I think he's great and he should keep up the good teaching!
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  The professor is very experienced and is willing to pass his knowledge to students.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Dr. Peduzzi is helpful and informative.
Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  Amazing professor, friend, and mentor

Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  The instructor was excellent. He dominated the topics and explained them clearly. He provided plenty of real life examples that helped to understand the concepts. He seemed to enjoy teaching and interacting with the students. He always encouraged us to ask questions.

Instructor: Peter Natale Peduzzi  He's great! Genuinely cares about his students. Love his philosophy of "pay it forward"....it's one of those phrases that will definitely stick with me even after this course.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Dr. Peduzzi instills the intuition necessary to evaluate and design clinical trials. Irrespective of concentration, this is an incredibly valuable class. Take it!

Recommended. Work load not to heavy. If you really put time into it, you can learn a lot. It's a must have course if you are interested in participate in clinical trial in future career, whether sponsors side, pharm side or physician side.

Muticenter cliicla trials are a complicated topic that will not be grasped over one semester, this course does a great job in highlighting the most important topics to learn and point in the future direction depending on you design of choice, recommend to anyone with serious interest in running the multicenter trials
Decent course on the subject of pragmatic clinical trials with plenty of stories of real life situations.
useful in understanding clinical trials
This course is worth taking if you are interested in designing clinical trails.
Great introduction to clinical trials and trial design.
The class is what you make of it. If you invest a lot, you will get a lot.

I would summarize it as an excellent advanced course in clinical trials which helps to expand and deepen the knowledge about the topic. I would definitely recommend it because of the course content and format, and of the professors expertise in the topic and ability to clearly explain the concepts.
Recommend.
